summary: The concept of "solar energy end-use applications" falls under the category of soft energy, emphasizing the utilization of solar power for various practical purposes. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, this term encompasses initiatives aimed at promoting renewable energy sources, particularly solar energy, to reduce dependency on fossil fuels and enhance sustainability. The EU has established directives and regulations that encourage the development and implementation of solar energy technologies, facilitating their integration into energy systems. As a redirect, this concept highlights the importance of end-use applications in achieving broader energy efficiency and climate goals within the EU.
